intro: Cantua longifolia, commonly known as the long-flowered cantua, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is characterized by its tall, upright stems and clusters of showy, violet-blue flowers. The plant belongs to the family Primulaceae and is known for its attractive, bell-shaped blooms. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value. Cantua longifolia is also used in horticulture for its ability to attract pollinators like bees and butterflies.
